column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: North Dakota
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column4: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.
column6: on the right.
column8: on the left.
column10: only if the other driver signals it is safe.

column2: 2. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column6: Merge left.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 3. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column8: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column10: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.

column2: 4. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column6: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.

column2: 5. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column4: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column6: the driver on the left must signal the driver on the right to go.
column8: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 6. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in the opposite direction of the skid.

column2: 7. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.
column6: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.
column8: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column10: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 9. A work zone:
column4: might involve vehicles and moving workers.
column6: does not require that the driver slow down and pay extra attention.
column8: is marked with black and white signs.

column2: 10. These are:
column4: route signs.
column6: miles-left signs.
column8: speed limit signs.

column2: 11. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: a divided highway ends ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 12. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: exiting a freeway.
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column8: following a motorcycle.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: Side road
column8: No Turning

column2: 14. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 15. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: high beam lights.
column6: low-beam lights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 16. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: safe to cross.
column6: a place where stopping is required.
column8: dangerous.
column10: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.

column2: 17. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: by slowing down and making sure they are being seen by pedestrians.
column8: when pedestrians are crossing within a marked or unmarked crosswalk.

column2: 18. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: speed up.
column6: use your brake lights.
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 19. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 20. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Slower vehicles must keep left.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 21. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column10: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 22. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: move into the left lane of a multilane road.
column6: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.
column8: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.

column2: 23. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: red; red
column6: yellow; black
column8: blue; white

column2: 24. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column10: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 25. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: look and listen for trains.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
